message_1: Suppose there are 10 individuals who can each contribute $20 to a public good with a total cost of $100. The public good provides a benefit of $200 to each individual who contributed. If everyone contributes, what will be the individual payoff for each person?
message_2:
If everyone contributes, each of the 10 individuals will contribute $20, which will cover the total cost of the public good ($100). Since the public good provides a benefit of $200 to each individual who contributed, each person will receive a benefit of $200.

To calculate the individual payoff for each person, we need to subtract their contribution from the benefit they receive:

Individual payoff = Benefit - Contribution
Individual payoff = $200 - $20
Individual payoff = $180

So, if everyone contributes, the individual payoff for each person will be $180.
